author: iammac
title: 2nd Best $8.00 I Ever Spent.
review:
Without a doubt, this is one of the most wanted single-piece sets of all time. Stop-motion makers, MOCers, and anyone who plays guys in a house, in a desert, on a volleyball court, on Mars, or in a giant vat of almond butter will like this set. Garunteed. I would post pictures of the completed set, but, y'know....Oh! There it is on the left-hand side of this review! And that's what it looks like in real life. 

Box/Instructions

The box was, in this case, a bag the plate's size and opened like a pack of fruit snacks. I don't want to sound like an AFOL, (no offense!) but the packaging was simple yet effective. The dotted arrow at the top right corner conveyed exactly how to get that Lego goodness out of that bag! Yellow is a good color.

Parts

What piece is individually more useful than this one?

Minifigures

I haven't found any yet.

The build

I must hold the world record for fastest assembly of a set. 0.1 seconds!

The completed model

A bit bare, but it perfectly depicts 99% of the Sahara Desert.

Overall opinion

Everybody needs one of these. Most need about 10 of them. "But it's eight dollars!" Well, think of it this way: You can either get this baseplate, or two CMFs and eight gumballs. Another big plus, my Prince of Persia palace fits on this baseplate perfectly! Couldn't have asked for a better color of plate either. I would buy one for you if I could. ;)
